page.title: 06BLACKMORE VALE MIXED FARMING
page.content: Here is a completely isolated area served by a rough track, with one deserted house.Mostly the land cover is the outlying pastures of a big farm with a small area of barley. Hotham Plantation,a cultivated woodland area of 12 acres,consists of well grown oak and ash trees with hazel and bramble undergrowth.Roughly 3 acres have been newly planted with young beech trees well protected from rabbits by plastic sheaths around the trunks.A well used bridle path circles this plantation.Young pheasants and grey squirrels are seen.The well trimmed hedgerows have the usual plants,nettles,hedge-parsley,comfrey. No one lives in this area which probably has no water or electricity supplies.In fact not even a good road. But in spite of the lack of amenities it is a most productive area.
